paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: some mutation carriers only develop first symptoms at the age of 70 years or older.
neuropathic pain is typically described as a burning sensation with worsening at night.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val50Met variant destabilizes the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloidogenesis.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.population_frequency: High prevalence in endemic areas, particularly in Portugal and Sweden.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on genotype-phenotype correlations.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is the most prevalent mutation associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most prevalent mutation worldwide is the exchange of the amino acid methionine for valine at protein position 50 (Val30Met).
Comparing endemic and non-endemic areas, the clinical course varies distinctly even within carriers of the same TTR mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the TTR gene was extracted successfully.
